question_stem.en: A 64-year-old woman is brought to the emergency department due to stroke-like symptoms. The patient has a history of transient ischemic attacks as well as other risk factors for cerebrovascular disease, including hypertension, type 2 diabetes mellitus, and hyperlipidemia. Urgent brain imaging reveals occlusion of a vessel indicated by the arrow in the exhibit. {{exhibit_1}} Which of the following findings is most likely to be observed in this patient?
question_stem.zh: 一名64岁女性因中风样症状被送至急诊科。患者有短暂性脑缺血发作史以及其他脑血管疾病的危险因素，包括高血压、2型糖尿病和高脂血症。紧急脑部影像学检查显示血管闭塞，如展品中的箭头所示。{{exhibit_1}} 该患者最有可能观察到的以下哪种表现？

question.en: Which of the following findings is most likely to be observed in this patient?
question.zh: 该患者最有可能观察到的以下哪种表现？

A.en: Down-and-out right eye with impaired extraocular movements
A.zh: 右眼向下和向外，伴有眼外肌运动障碍

B.en: Left-sided motor weakness, including lower facial region
B.zh: 左侧肢体无力，包括面部下部

C.en: Loss of conjugate lateral gaze on both sides

D.en: Sensory loss over the right side of the face and left side of the body
D.zh: 面部右侧和身体左侧感觉丧失

E.en: Vision loss over the left half of the visual field in both eyes
E.zh: 双眼视野左半部分视力丧失

explanation.en:
This patient has occlusion of the right posterior inferior cerebellar artery (PICA), which arises from the vertebral artery. Occlusion of the PICA results in lateral medullary (Wallenberg) syndrome. This disorder classically results in a constellation of symptoms because of damage to specific areas:

* Vertigo and nystagmus (vestibular nucleus)
* Ataxia (inferior cerebellar peduncle)
* Loss of pain and temperature sensation in the ipsilateral face (spinal trigeminal nucleus) and contralateral body (spinothalamic tract)
* Bulbar weakness (eg, dysphagia, dysarthria) (nucleus ambiguus)

Horner syndrome (ie, miosis, ptosis, anhidrosis) may also occur in the ipsilateral eye due to damage to descending sympathetic nervous system fibers.

{{exhibit_2}} The diagram illustrates the structures affected in lateral medullary syndrome.

(Choice A) Damage to the oculomotor nerve (CN III) can lead to impaired extraocular movements with a down-and-out eye due to unopposed action of the superior oblique muscle (innervated by the trochlear nerve [CN IV]) and the lateral rectus muscle (innervated by the abducens nerve [CN VI]). When this finding (ie, down-and-out eye) is accompanied by contralateral lower facial weakness and hemiplegia, it is suggestive of midbrain infarction due to occlusion of the posterior cerebral artery (ie, Weber syndrome).

(Choice B) Hemiparesis of the arm and leg with an upper motor neuron pattern of facial weakness (ie, only involves the lower face) is the classic presentation of an internal capsule stroke. The internal capsule is supplied by the lenticulostriate arteries, which are branches of the MCA.

(Choice C) Internuclear ophthalmoplegia (ie, loss of conjugate lateral gaze) is caused by damage to the medial longitudinal fasciculus, which can occur with occlusion affecting the pontine arteries. Bilateral loss of conjugate gaze is more likely with other etiologies (eg, multiple sclerosis plaques) because bilateral ischemic injury to the same area is uncommon.

(Choice E) Homonymous hemianopia (ie, vision loss in the same half of the visual field in both eyes) with macular sparing is classically caused by occlusion of the posterior cerebral artery; the macula is spared due to collateral blood supply from the middle cerebral artery. Homonymous hemianopia without macular sparing can occur due to damage of the optic tract or optic radiation, which can occur with several different vessels (eg, anterior choroidal, middle cerebral artery).

Educational objective:
Posterior inferior cerebellar artery occlusion causes lateral medullary (Wallenberg) syndrome. This disorder is characterized by vertigo/nystagmus, ipsilateral cerebellar signs, loss of pain/temperature sensation in the ipsilateral face and contralateral body, bulbar weakness, and ipsilateral Horner syndrome.
explanation.zh:
该患者右侧后下小脑动脉 (PICA) 闭塞，该动脉源自椎动脉。PICA 闭塞导致延髓外侧 (Wallenberg) 综合征。这种疾病通常会导致一系列症状，因为特定区域的损伤：

* 眩晕和眼球震颤（前庭神经核）
* 共济失调（小脑下脚）
* 面部同侧疼痛和温度感觉丧失（脊髓三叉神经核）和对侧身体（脊髓丘脑束）
* 延髓无力（如吞咽困难、构音障碍）（疑核）

由于损伤下降交感神经系统纤维，同侧眼睛也可能发生霍纳综合征（即瞳孔缩小、眼睑下垂、无汗症）。

{{exhibit_2}} 该图说明了延髓外侧综合征中受影响的结构。

（选项 A）动眼神经（CN III）的损伤可导致眼外肌运动障碍，伴有眼球向下和向外，这要归因于斜上肌（由滑车神经[CN IV]支配）和外直肌（由外展神经[CN VI]支配）的拮抗作用。当这种发现（即眼球向下和向外）伴有对侧面部下部无力和偏瘫时，提示由于大脑后动脉闭塞导致的中脑梗死（即 Weber 综合征）。

（选项 B）肢体偏瘫伴有面部无力（即仅涉及面部下部）的上运动神经元模式是内囊卒中的典型表现。内囊由豆纹动脉供应，豆纹动脉是大脑中动脉的分支。

（选项 C）核间性眼肌麻痹（即共轭侧视丧失）是由内纵束损伤引起的，内纵束损伤可发生在影响脑桥动脉的闭塞时。双侧共轭凝视丧失更可能与其他病因相关（如多发性硬化斑块），因为双侧同一区域的缺血性损伤并不常见。

（选项 E）同侧偏盲（即双眼视野的同一半部分视力丧失）伴黄斑保留通常由大脑后动脉闭塞引起；黄斑因大脑中动脉的侧支血供而得以保留。无黄斑保留的同侧偏盲可因视束或视辐射损伤而发生，这可发生在几条不同的血管中（如前脉络丛动脉、大脑中动脉）。

教育目标：
后下小脑动脉闭塞引起延髓外侧（Wallenberg）综合征。这种疾病的特征是眩晕/眼球震颤、同侧小脑体征、面部同侧和身体对侧疼痛/温度感觉丧失、延髓无力和同侧霍纳综合征。

summary.en:
This question tests the understanding of lateral medullary syndrome (Wallenberg syndrome), its characteristic clinical manifestations, and the neuroanatomical basis of these symptoms resulting from occlusion of the posterior inferior cerebellar artery (PICA).

To solve this question, one must identify the likely vascular territory affected based on the clinical presentation and risk factors, then correlate the specific neurological deficits with the structures damaged in that territory, particularly the brainstem nuclei and pathways involved in Wallenberg syndrome.
summary.zh:
此题考察了对延髓外侧综合征（Wallenberg 综合征）、其特征性临床表现以及由后下小脑动脉 (PICA) 闭塞引起的这些症状的神经解剖学基础的理解。

要解决这个问题，必须根据临床表现和危险因素确定可能受影响的血管区域，然后将特定的神经系统缺陷与该区域受损的结构相关联，特别是 Wallenberg 综合征中涉及的脑干核和通路。
